conclusion: Objects A and B are dropped onto objects C, D, E, F due to gravity.
Object A is a yellow ball positioned above a small yellow cube labeled C.
Object B is a green ball positioned above three cubes labeled D (green), E (orange), and F (yellow).
Each ball will strike the cube it is directly above when dropped.
Both balls will land on the top faces of their corresponding cubes and come to rest there.
The cubes are wide and stable enough to support the balls, preventing further motion such as bouncing away.
